ai.summary: ACW Circular Walk 04 is a demanding 38 km circular hike in the UK. Rated hard, the route traverses varied terrain in an unknown region and tests endurance, navigation, and weather resilience.
ai.terrain_summary: Expect a mix of steep climbs, rocky paths, uneven trails, grassy sections and occasional road crossings. Long, remote stretches mean limited shelter and amenities; mud and boggy sections are common after rain.
ai.safety_notes: Hard 38 km route in potentially remote terrain. Plan for a 9–12 hour day; check weather and daylight. Wear sturdy boots and carry navigation tools (map, compass or GPS) and a fully charged phone. In an unknown region, signs may be sparse—bring a physical map as backup. Inform someone of your plan, carry extra food and water, a first aid kit, emergency shelter, and a whistle. Adjust pace or turn back if conditions worsen.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good ankle support
Water bottle or hydration system (2–3 litres total)
Weather-appropriate layers (base layer, mid-layer, waterproof shell)
Map and compass (or GPS) and a fully charged phone with offline maps
Extra socks and a spare set of dry clothing
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn (roughly March to October) for best weather; the route is possible year-round with extra precautions in winter.

seo.title: ACW Circular Walk 04 — 38 km Hard Circular Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Plan and prepare for ACW Circular Walk 04, a challenging 38 km circular route in the UK. Terrain, safety tips, gear recommendations, and best seasons included.
